channel.title: [Delta] RS2 is back: from vacation xD Project/learning Java
channel.description:
[ul][b]Server Base:[/b] [i]Delta, [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,461231.msg3374195.html#msg3374195]Ix Soulcist xI's Bronze Age V2.0[/i] [b]Client Base:[/b] [i]Just a regular 317 deob[/i]
The main reason for my development thread is to show people what I have achieved in the time of making my project and to show myself. The main reason I started this project was because I wanted to learn some Java because I think it is one of the most amazing things on the internet and that I am still in love with RS2.
[center] [b]My story:[/b] So my friends, I am currently learning Java in my own time and am in love with the old Runescape, we're talking 2004-2006ish which is perfect for a 317 IMO, so in my spare time I try to program my server as much as I can to mimic the olden days and hopefully one day me and my friends can reinact the old Runescape feel on my server. [/center]
[b]What I am working on:[/b]
[color=green][b]Firemaking:[/b]
Yes, I am currently working on Firemaking, of course I want it to be 100% but I am having a slight issue with it as I cannot make my character move 1 space west in an event using:[/ul] [code=java]fmwalkto(-1, 0);[/code] so for now, this is my product: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PX3czJmTaZ0 [b]Note:[/b] I made it so logs don't delete so I don't have to keep spawning the fucking things
I wouldn't expect an update on this thread everyday, nor every second :p this is out of mere fun and for the sake of sticking to something I like: Java. If you're going to hate then meh, I have balls of steel! But seriously, if anybody could solve the mystery of problems I post in my development thread, all will be rewarded and thanked :p
[b]Credits:[/b] [i]Delta, Sanity, Ix Soulcist xI[/i]

item.title: [Delta] RS2 is back: from vacation xD Project/learning Java
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Sir Jay, post:7, topic:375603”][quote author=Python_ link=topic=471538.msg3448944#msg3448944 date=1293603728]

Use the normal walkto method?

Tried mate, it doesn’t seem to work in events although it will work outside of them which is no use to me at the moment.

That doesn’t make any sense…

Use Shards Revolution instead.

If I ever see you in person, I’m going to shank you to death.

[/quote]

I should try to make it clear for you to understand it.

When I put “walkTo(-1,0);” inside my event, it will not work. However, when I put it outside the event but keep it inside my method it will work.[/quote]

Hmm. Thats weird.

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] RS2 is back: from vacation xD Project/learning Java

@Sir_Jay wrote:

[ul]Server Base: Delta, [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,461231.msg3374195.html#msg3374195]Ix Soulcist xI’s Bronze Age V2.0
Client Base: Just a regular 317 deob

The main reason for my development thread is to show people what I have achieved in the time of making my project and to show myself. The main reason I started this project was because I wanted to learn some Java because I think it is one of the most amazing things on the internet and that I am still in love with RS2.

[center]
My story:
So my friends, I am currently learning Java in my own time and am in love with the old Runescape, we’re talking 2004-2006ish which is perfect for a 317 IMO, so in my spare time I try to program my server as much as I can to mimic the olden days and hopefully one day me and my friends can reinact the old Runescape feel on my server.
[/center]

What I am working on:

[color=green]Firemaking:

Yes, I am currently working on Firemaking, of course I want it to be 100% but I am having a slight issue with it as I cannot make my character move 1 space west in an event using:[/ul]

fmwalkto(-1, 0);

so for now, this is my product:


Note: I made it so logs don’t delete so I don’t have to keep spawning the fucking things

I wouldn’t expect an update on this thread everyday, nor every second this is out of mere fun and for the sake of sticking to something I like: Java. If you’re going to hate then meh, I have balls of steel!
But seriously, if anybody could solve the mystery of problems I post in my development thread, all will be rewarded and thanked
